result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis L Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexis L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Dawn Rablin appeared in court on behalf of Helmi Hamad for Alexis L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is not in compliance with the deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant needs to complete the community service hours, make restitution payments, and re-engage with therapist in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.13.2022

Defendant Alexis L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Alexis L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in compliance with the terms of the agreement. Defendant needs to complete the community service hours and continue attending treatment. State requested that the case be staffed. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 9.16.2022
Received and Filed. Letter of Apology

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review. 
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

Defendant Alexis L Smith in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense counsel and defendant acknowledges receipt of amended criminal complaint,.
  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea form
Received and Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
